Job Description

Who are we? 

DuPont Sustainable Solutions (DSS) is a global operations management consulting firm specializing in operational risk management, cultural transformation, and operational improvement. As advisors to leading industrial companies for over 50 years, we are in the business of saving lives, improving operational performance, and creating a more sustainable future.

As a complement to our robust Management Consulting offerings, our Learning and Development Team has 35+ years experience in developing Blended Learning to protect employees and increase productivity through a team of experts dedicated to helping clients. Accelerate Capability Building through developing custom and personalized solutions. We have a Strong Focus on Re-Skilling to meet evolving business needs. As trusted partners, we deliver innovative Digital Solutions which effectively Engage your Dispersed Workforce through Technology in this new reality. We understand the implications of Technology and the Human Factor. We thrive on delivering real value to our clients; transforming their cultures, processes, and capabilities for sustainable, long-term results across the entire organization. What do we offer? An opportunity to lead our growing, experienced Leaning & Development Sales Team into the next level of success by managing, directing, training, and attracting new recruits, in conjunction with talent acquisition.

What will you do?

While embodying our core values and mission critical behaviors you will:
 Work closely with DSS L&D Business Leaders to achieve strategic objectives with accounts and business. Manage and monitor key sales metrics and provides guidance on improving overall sales performance. Ensure monthly, quarterly and annual goals (recognized revenue and bookings) are established and achieved. Generate business forecast projections, in alignment with established reporting cadence. Leverage systems and processes, accurately forecasting, maintaining pipeline velocity and achieving a strong close ratio across all sales opportunities. Engage cross-functional teams to achieve the organization’s goals through collaboration and sharing best practices. Support and contribute to the overall sales strategy for the business, designed to meet sales metrics, based on a solid understanding of all facets of the training marketplace. Work with Business Leaders and Marketing in gathering competitive intelligence on the market, setting a market strategy for success. Keeps up to date on trends in the market by reading trade journals, books, periodicals, news reports, client websites, etc. Attend conferences, conventions and trade association meetings associated with the marketplace as an opportunity to gain a better understanding of the market, gather competitive intelligence, and position DSS as a thought leader. Work with the DSS Product Managers and business leaders in identifying product development needs to meet the demands of the market. Exhibit and model a professional presence, with excellent interpersonal communication and organization skills. Works with sales team members in setting their individual sales goals and metrics to support the goals of the business. Serve as a catalyst, pace-setter and demonstrates motivational behaviors for the team.
Job requirements

What will you offer?
 A Bachelor’s Level Education 10 plus years of sales management experience At least 5 years’ experience of selling complex solutions to large accounts, preferably in learning solutions Experience in managing sales resources Experience in managing sales targets and forecasting Services selling experience preferred Established experience with CRM platforms and reporting Experience with sales and revenue forecasting Client support and outcomes focused Exhibit Leadership & Influence Love Coaching and Developing Talent Kean Comprehension of Execution & Results Foster Teamwork & Collaboration

Our industry leading technology enables the secure flow of information, empowering the largest banks and companies around the world to execute deals more productively, safely, and with complete confidence. As a Sales Manager, you will be responsible for leading a team of Account Executives who are working directly with our largest deal-making clients enabling some of the most strategic and most highly visible transactions in the business world.

Specifically, We Are Looking For a Leader Who Possesses The Following Capabilities

We are looking for a proven sales leader who is highly motivated to lead a team of energetic, positive sales professionals while continuing to build the Intralinks business within their geography.
Strong people leadershipAgent of growth and changeChampion of operational excellenceExpert seller and sales coach
In This Role, You Will Be Accountable For The Following

At Intralinks, we develop relationships with both Advisory (Investment Banks & Law Firms) and Corporate Development professionals (Fortune 1000 corporate dealmakers). We provide business value to customers by providing solutions that enable mission critical mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, capital raises and corporate restructuring, and other strategic transactions.
Leading a team of 6 – 8 Account Executives while consistently exceeding revenue goals and sales targets.Leading by example and providing real time coaching by participating in and/or leading client and prospect meetings. This includes consistently meeting with VP and C-levels clients.Growing and developing talent through effective recruiting, hiring, and supporting professional development planning.Demonstrating Operational Excellence by accurately reporting on sales activity, forecast, and pipeline management to senior leaders.Collaborating with cross functional Intralinks organizations to support unique customer needs, escalations, and achieve greater organizational impact.Recommending strategies to capture opportunities and grow your business.
Qualifications
Minimum 8 years of sales experience including prior success selling SaaS/IaaS/PaaS/Software solutions to large corporate accounts or financial services institutions.Minimum 24 months sales management experience including experience hiring, developing, and coaching salespeople.Proven capability developing VP and/or C-level client relationships.Experience building high performing sales teams and creating positive sales cultures.Strong oral and written communication skills and executive presence.Excellent negotiation skills.Strong business acumen and resourcefulness.A self-starter that can work independently in a fast-paced environment with high volume sales.Training or commensurate experience with Solution Selling, Challenger, Force Management or equivalent consultative sales methodology.Bachelor’s degree.Ability to travel (40%)
It Would Be Great If You Also Had
A degree in Finance or Business Administration.Financial Services experience including working in or selling to Investment Banks, Private Equity, Legal and Financial Advisors, Corporate Development, Finance, and/or Legal teams.Experience incubating new technology and collaborating with cross functional teams, including engineering and product marketing to build and improve products/services.SalesForce.com expertise.

jobDescription:
Ready to take your career in sales to the next level? Yelp is looking for Sales Managers of all levels to join as key members of Yelp’s Local Sales team. With over 138 million unique monthly visitors to the site, a rapidly expanding user community, and a built-in forum for consumer interactions, Yelp is a fantastic place for advertisers to reach an actively engaged audience. You will be responsible for managing a team of 10-12 inside sales executives while driving monthly revenue targets through new business acquisition. Our fast-paced sales team has a positive attitude and drive to win. This is a great opportunity to grow your career, make money, and have fun doing it.

Where You Come In
You will provide hands on coaching and feedback to a team of Account Executives, who are charged with bringing in new business against monthly revenue targetsYou will coach, develop and motivate your team of reps to become top achievers and future leaders.You will share best practices when it comes to inside sales (phone) and closing effectivelyYou will hold your team accountable to ensuring that our products, policies and pricing are communicated clearly and accurately to prospects, and that we leave a positive impression on everyone we interact withYou will lead effective team meetings, one on one’s, and group trainingsYou will exceed monthly sales team quotas and successfully complete all activities that drive revenue generationYou will implement strategic sales training, planning, and forecastingYou will assess your team accurately to provide best coaching while quickly ramping on all of Yelp’s ad products and addressable market dynamics
What It Takes To Succeed
You operate at the highest standard of professionalism in meetings with internal and external clients and stakeholders, in personal presentation and general interactions.You consider yourself to be highly motivated, self directed and possess high energy.You can handle confidential information with discretion and maturity.You can operate with high integrity and personal accountability.You have a personal embodiment of all Yelp values.You must take initiative and be solution oriented at all times.You have an unrelenting work ethic.You are a self-starter.You have critical time management skills and personal judgment.You have an exceptional customer service focus combined with exemplary follow-through.You have 1+ years of experience effectively developing, managing and leading inside sales teamsYou are a thoughtful leader with excellent communication skills and high emotional intelligenceYou are able to empathize with, inspire and relate to a diverse workforce and a diverse customer baseYou have a consistent track record of success leading a team to exceed revenue goalsYou have a demonstrated ability to implement and train sales teams in strategic selling techniquesYou have strong leadership qualities with the ability to coach, develop and motivate a teamYou have experience developing sales plans and analyzing metricsYou have experience selling digital products to SMBs preferred but not requiredYou have Salesforce CRM experience, preferred but not requiredYou hold a Bachelor's degree OR three years of customer-facing experience requiredYou hold a HS Diploma or GED
What You'll Get
Available your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (Employee-only plans available at no cost to the employee)15 days PTO per year for first 2 years of employment (accrual begins on date of hire); number of PTO days increases after 2 years of tenure, 5 paid wellness days, 12 paid holidays, 1 floating holidayUp to 14 weeks of parental leaveMonthly wellness reimbursementHealth Savings, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care accounts401(k) retirement savings plan with employer matchEmployee stock purchase plan
At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

jobTitle: Sales Development Representative - Work from Home
jobDescription:
Leader in supplemental benefits, Meridio, is seeking an ambitious and experienced Sales Development Representative.

Competitive Compensation: 30K Base, plus commissions; on target earnings 50K

Meridio offers great benefits, including: Medical, Vision, and Dental coverage, plus a wide range and suite of additional voluntary benefits. Plus 14 days of PTO and 8 paid holidays.

This is a Remote, full-time position.

Sales Development Representative Overview

As a Sales Development Representative you will reach out to businesses and provide them with a better way to offer benefits to their employees. Your sales process will run from initial prospecting to interaction while building genuine connections with business owners and ultimately closing. You will consistently be provided with leads from our extensive list of Meridio partnerships.

Sales Development Representative Requirements
2 years or more of outbound/inbound sales experience.Excellent communication skills - no fear of the phone.General computer and email proficiency, experience with working in a CRM is a must.Positive attitude and a drive to win.Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and manage time within a fast-paced environment.Learn industry-leading communication and sales techniques that will enable you to find solutions for your clients and close deals.Gain extensive knowledge of an automated sales platform including Pipedrive, Aircall and Autopilot.Mentor directly with highly experienced sales managers and closers and receive daily feedback.
Sales Development Representative Responsibilities
Manage your own opportunities. Utilize online and offline sources to cultivate new leads while developing and maintaining your pipeline.Drive the full sales cycle primarily through inside sales: make introductory calls, assess business goals through qualifying, and close the deal.Become an expert in Meridio's unique platform by asking probing questions. Handling objections will be critical to your success.Achieve and consistently exceed monthly sales goals.
Who We Are

We are a team of technology specialists and capable insurance salespeople who see the traditional benefits industry in the rearview mirror. We come from all backgrounds, and we have all seen the pitfalls of buying benefits the traditional way. Recognizing that modern tools, better communication, and a white-glove touch is essential for better benefits outcomes, we embarked on a mission to connect people to benefits, when they want them, in a modern guided approach. Meridio has developed an intuitive and seamless platform that goes beyond the traditional benefits brokerage. We work with associations, platforms, and other group networks to provide their members with the best possible experience for buying benefits. Meridio is boldly changing the way benefits are marketed and acquired. If you want to do well and do good, join Meridio - together we can build a better benefits experience for everyone.

We are a start-up that aims to transform Latin America through education. Our team is based in Peru, Colombia, Mexico, Argentina, Chile, Ecuador, and Bolivia, and works towards the same goal: to make everyone's professional dream possible.

We started operations in 2015, and since, we have raised more than US$ 20 million of VC in 3 investment rounds. We are supported by global and regional investors, such as Acumen Capital, Mountain Nazca, Salesforce Ventures, and Rethink Education, with whom we seek to scale our course catalog, develop new products, consolidate our regional brand, and expand to new markets.

Crehana is growing by leaps and bounds, and our goal of being the leading education platform in the region is what drives us. This is where you come to play: we are looking for a Sales Manager in Lima, Perú to join our team and help us become the biggest EdTech in Latin America, transforming 700 million lives through education.

Your mission as a Sales Manager will be leading a fast-paced, highly-visible sales team that generates revenues and exceeds organizational and individual quotas. You'll be instrumental in driving the Crehana sales and company strategy. We are looking for an experienced, driven sales manager with a proven track record of success using a value-driven sales approach. If you are looking for a professional challenge that tests your knowledge and skills every day, we have the role for you!

As Sales Manager in Perú, you will be able to:
 Be responsible for setting and executing Crehana’s sales strategy for a given region. This leader will assume responsibility for a growing sales team to help drive complex deal transactions.  Revenue accountability will exceed $6MM annually  Manage and take accountability for negotiated non-standard contractual terms and conditions  Manage the performance of the Commercial Account Executive team including: recruiting, hiring, training, and professional development of individual team members  Support the targeting, planning, positioning, and execution of commercial opportunity development efforts as necessary to maximize the probability of success  Manage overall sales process, set appropriate metrics for sales funnel management  Set and execute an aggressive customer acquisition strategy to generate annual growth in revenue and bookings for the region  Work directly with the senior management team to shape strategies for driving sustainable business growth  Provide detailed and accurate sales forecasting to senior leadership  Plan and manage at both the strategic and operational levels  Collaborate with senior leaders and other relevant stakeholders to create, implement and manage policies and procedures to effectively support the business  Create and execute effective presentations, including corporate and solution capabilities, prospective client proposals, bid defense and business case/justification  Support Business Development efforts by attending industry conferences and events Supporting direct reports by participating and leading in client and prospect meetings and engaging other corporate resources as required  Ongoing mentoring and development of sales team which includes recruiting, on-boarding and training new Account Executives  Conducting weekly forecast meetings & one-on-one reviews with direct reports  Reporting on all aspects of the business to senior sales management  Monitoring the sales activity of the team, and tracking the results  Plan and execute marketing events in territory 

You Should Have
 Bachelor's degree and have a demonstrable, successful track record with a minimum of 5-8+ years experience in sales and a minimum of 3 as a sales manager  Strong negotiation skills and proven experience of successfully selling to and closing 7-figure contracts at the CxO level; familiarity with SaaS solutions for technical education is preferred  Strong interpersonal and communication skills; in addition, must have the ability to synthesize complex business challenges and create clear solutions and messages for audiences at various levels of sophistication  Must be a team player, able to handle ambiguity, anticipate and react to changes in a rapidly evolving environment  Consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals as a sales leader  Proven track record of building satisfied, loyal and reference able customers  Strong track record of recruiting, training/developing and retaining high performing sales talent  Ability to to listen, think logically, strategically, and tactically to solve complex problems  Self-motivated, demonstrating an ability to assume responsibility and work autonomously  Successful track record of planning, executing and closing business from field events  Strong operational and analytical abilities Ideal candidates will possess strong sales leadership experience, having sold software solutions to commercial and enterprise companies at the Director, VP and C level 

Benefits

We care about the well-being of our team, both personally and professionally. Therefore, we have a Wellness & Benefits Program that meets the diverse needs of each Crehaner. If you want to know more, make sure to check this link.

You will be part of one of the online learning platforms with the greatest growth projection in Latin America and Spain. There are already more than 4 million students around the world and more than 100 companies that trust Crehana. We are part of Wayra, Startup Peru, Emerge Education, and Endeavor Global.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

At Crehana, we don't just accept differences: we celebrate, support, and promote diversity as an important pillar of our culture. We pride ourselves on being a workplace with equal opportunities for everyone and anyone, regardless of religion, race, nationality, origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, or person with any type of disability. Our goal is to have a diverse team that represents what we seek to build: an inclusive, empowered, and educated Latin America.

Covid-19

We have decided to remain working remotely in all of our locations. Our number one priority is that our team and the people they care for are safe and well.

Job Description

3M Inside Sales Representative (Evergreen) (Open)

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 96,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.

“At 3M, we excel by combining our talents while leveraging creative and curious minds. This is most impactful when we center our objective at improving the customer experience. It’s a privilege to work for such a great company, with amazing people, and leadership that cultivates a growth-mindset.” – Eric Hammes, executive vice president of Enterprise Operations at 3M

This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

The Inside Sales Representative will establish and maintain customer relationships, drive sales growth through virtual sales, up sell, and cross sell strategically aligned products within focused markets. This will be accomplished by utilizing detailed product and market knowledge in order to aid distribution partners and customers. This sales representative will be accountable to achieve monthly phone and activity goals while driving sales pipeline health and exceeding sales forecast through customer interactions, business plan creation and execution, and teaming with field sales representatives when appropriate.

Here, You Will Make An Impact By

As an Inside Sales Rep, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Driving 3M sales to assigned distribution in managed territories.Establishing and maintaining customer relationships through a comprehensive understanding of the customer’s business/sales models to help manage and influence business growth.Introducing new products, and communicating promotions to relevant customers and prospectsMaintaining and updating a working sales plan with strategies and tactics to achieve annual sales forecastsDemonstrating a proficient level of procedural and technical product knowledge to identify products that meet customer needsWorking to attain sales quota, sales quality, and sales productivity metricsSharing best practices with the team to promote a positive team environmentProficiently identifying market trends and account needs in order to react to market activity and reach favorable sales goals

Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher from (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution 

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

One (1) or more years of outside sales and/or inside sales experienceAccount management experiencePrevious retail experience is preferredSalesforce.com experience is desiredSkills include solution selling, listening skills, gain commitmentAbility to work effectively in a sales team environment - Creative problem-solving abilities are preferred Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing work environmentStrong organizational skills, with the ability to stay on tasks and maintain high productivity levels while working both in the office and remotely

Location: Positions will be performed remotely within the continental US and are not located at the corporate campus.

Travel: No Travel is anticipated or will be required

Relocation Assistance: Is Not Authorized

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.

Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.

Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.

3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

Symmetry Financial Group was established with the goal of helping to bring balance to the professional and personal lives of independent insurance agents and agency builders across the country.

By focusing on a more balanced distribution of commissions, SFG is truly committed to sharing the wealth of opportunity with you, all while delivering high levels of service and training to our sales force.

jobDescription:
About NCR

NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is a leading software- and services-led enterprise provider in the financial, retail and hospitality industries. NCR is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with 36,000 employees globally. NCR is a trademark of NCR Corporation in the United States and other countries.

Position Summary

The demand for our services is great and we are looking for a dynamic Sales Specialist to join us. Your focus will be on driving new business growth of our medium to large market segment offering our best in class Payroll and HR solutions to employers in your assigned market in order to empower them to most effectively manage the Hire --> Retire continuum for their organizations.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter, passionate about solving problems and have a proven track record of selling business, outsourcing or consulting related services to organizations of various sizes.

Responsibilities
Reach and exceed assigned sales goals for full-suite of HCM solutions including; HR, TLM, Payroll, Benefits Administration, ACA, WOTC, Applicant Tracking, COBRA Administration and other NCR Payroll & HR solutions. Implement sales strategies targeting Presidents, CEOs, CFOs, and Owners to convert prospects into clientsNetwork and develop relationships with C-level, HR and Sr. Financial ExecutivesMine existing and prospective clients for referral businessDevelop and execute a cold calling strategy to target prospectsDevelop a network in person and via phone with key decision makers in an assigned/designated territoryEstablish and maintain strong relationships, with both internal and external customersProactively connect clients' business needs with NCR Payroll & HR Solutions portfolio of products and servicesCross-sell other and adjacent NCR solutions to existing clientsRepresent NCR Payroll & HR Solutions in the field, at trade shows and seminarsDevelop and maintain relationships with other networking and business groups in the territory
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree preferred Minimum of 3 years of Outside and/or Inside business-to-business sales experience, preferably in HCM or SaaS environment and with a proven track record in selling and presentation skills, prospecting, and territory management
Preferred Qualifications: Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:
Experience selling mid-market (>100 Employees) HR/HCM solutions -- particular interest in experience selling full-suite solutions such as iSolvedBusiness-to-business experience, including business equipment or software – particularly sales of HCM - HR, TLM, Payroll or related business servicesTenacious, goal oriented and ambitious, with capacity and drive to reach and exceed quotasDemonstrated cold calling sales ability, with assertive, positive and persistent styleProven customer service and relationship building skillsStrong verbal and written communication skillsOrganized, with effective time management skillsAbility to work independently and as a teamSelf-confident and Professionally competitiveCapacity to work under pressureStrong work ethic with high level of personal accountabilityCommitted to building a career in Sales and/or Sales Leadership
Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the job.

Full Time Employee Benefits Include
Medical InsuranceDental InsuranceLife InsuranceVision InsuranceShort/Long Term DisabilityPaid Vacation401k
EEO Statement

Integrated into our shared values is NCR's commitment to diversity and equal employment opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, military service, genetic information, or any other characteristic or conduct protected by law. NCR is committed to being a globally inclusive company where all people are treated fairly, recognized for their individuality, promoted based on performance and encouraged to strive to reach their full potential. We believe in understanding and respecting differences among all people. Every individual at NCR has an ongoing responsibility to respect and support a globally diverse environment.

Statement to Third Party Agencies

To ALL recruitment agencies: NCR only accepts resumes from agencies on the NCR preferred supplier list. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, NCR employees, or any NCR facility. NCR is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

About SmileBackSmileBack is the leading customer satisfaction system for Managed Service Providers in the IT services industry. We make it easy for companies to get loads of useful information about how satisfied their customers are, understand it and act on it. Our product is deeply valued by our customers, and their success is always our number-one priority.
Why work with usAs a bootstrapped SaaS company, we're agile, we're independent and you'll be exposed to industry-leading technologies and practices from day one. Our team is small and close-knit, even though we're spread across five countries.
We've also adopted a "Flexwork" model, meaning our employees are supported in their preferred working style and environment, including a dedicated co-working space in Berlin, Germany, and a home office stipend to make sure you have what you need if you prefer to work remotely.
We spend the bulk of our days figuring out how to solve problems for our customers and build value into our product. We engage directly and often with our users, and they take an active role in shaping our product and company through their feedback.
We've developed a highly integrated, highly integrated approach to our work that is productive, efficient and fun. Our focus is on constant iteration and improvement in everything that we do: be it our thought leadership, our product, or our internal operations.
SmileBack's Growth TeamThe Growth Team helps prospective customers understand the value of our product and what it can do for their business. We've taken the traditional silos of Sales and Marketing and combined them into one unified team that actively engages our prospects to spread awareness and demonstrate the value of integrating a feedback system into their business. The Growth Team owns the buyer's journey from awareness to subscription, and we focus our efforts on both increasing our number of monthly leads and converting them into customers.
The PositionLeading the Growth Team, you'll take full responsibility of the buyer's journey from generating leads to closing deals. This role is both about getting your hands dirty in the day-to-day, as well as thinking and leading strategically. You'll take accountability for all key Growth initiatives, including lead generation, managing the sales cycle, CRM campaigns, events and content. If you're highly adaptable, love engaging with people and have a fundamental understanding of how to communicate value throughout multiple stages of the buyers journey then this role is for you.What you'll do:Generate leads via marketing channels, in particular by attending regular industry events in Europe, the UK and North AmericaPerform product demonstrations and manage a pipeline of dealsContinuously work to improve conversion rates in the funnelRun CRM campaigns on our leads databaseContribute ideas for growth, customer and product teams
Your ProfileHighly communicative, you love engaging with people and aren't afraid to deal with problemsAbility to multi-task, set priorities, and manage time effectivelyAmbitious, entrepreneurial, and always on the lookout for ways to optimize and improve on the status quoResults oriented with the ability to 'see around corners'Pragmatic in your approach with a deference to simplicityStrong aptitude for technology and interest in continual learning
CompensationWe offer a competitive salary plus inclusion in our company-wide incentive/ profit-sharing plan
RequirementsExcellent spoken and written English with the ability to persuade2-3 years experience in sales and/or marketing, preferably B2BExperience managing 1-2 other employees and/or leading a small team
﻿How to applyPlease apply by emailing rory@smileback.com including both a CV and a personal statement that explains why you are interested in this role and gives examples of how you meet the requirements. Applications without a statement will not be answered. No recruiters.
What's next?We believe in a quick and clear interview process. The interview process will involve three conversations in quick succession:Interview 1: Growth Lead 👋🏻An overview of the position and team with a specific focus on aptitude around engaging with prospects and managing a sales cycleInterview 2: Customer + Technology Leads 🤝A discussion about the larger company, how we work and our internal cultureInterview 3: Managing Director 🚀A final conversation with the Managing Director, to whom the position will report, with a focus on your professional interests and potential growth trajectoryOffer! 🤑

Description

 About Syngenta 

Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.

About Us

Through leading innovations, we help farmers around the world meet the challenge of feeding a growing population and taking care of our planet. In this role, the Territory Sales Representative willbuild strong customer relationships and generate awareness and demand for the Syngenta CP portfolio within assigned geography.

This position is ideally based near the town of St-Hyacinthe, QC covering the Monteregie area .

Accountabilities
  Analyze market trends to identify data-driven growth opportunities
  Complete product forecasting requirements
  Achieve annual sales target for, crop protection and seedcare
  Develop and implement local field marketing plan
  Utilize discovery skills to understand retailer and grower needs
  Develop retailer business plans that integrates offer to the grower
  Deliver and reconcile programs or segmented offers to retailers
  Ability to effectively communicate the value of product portfolio and services
  Train and develop retailers to effectively position product to growers
  Create awareness of technology (demonstration trials, capture experiences)
  Product service and support
 

Qualifications

 Requirements 
  Bachelor’s degree in Agriculture or Science and/or a Business Communication
  Minimum 3 years’ experience in the Ag industry; experience in the commercial and/or research sides of business an asset
  Candidate must be member of the Quebec Order of Agrologists (OAQ)
  Broad technical knowledge of the company portfolio, competitive products, as well as current and emerging agricultural practices and trends in the seed and crop protection industries.
  Strong strategic influencing and negotiation skills
  Understanding of financial analysis and general business issues and practices.
  Knowledge of commercial and product strategies.
  Must have a valid driver’s license in good standing.
  Overnight travel requirements 10-15%
  Must be fully bilingual (English/French)
 

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Syngenta Contact Information

If you need assistance during the application process, please contact the Service Desk at recruitment.na@syngenta.com

Syngenta Canada welcomes applications from all qualified candidates and is able to accommodate persons with disabilities. For more information about accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process or if you would like more information on our accommodation policies, please contact recruitment.na@syngenta.com

Job Description

3M Inside Sales Representative (Evergreen) (Open)

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 96,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.

“At 3M, we excel by combining our talents while leveraging creative and curious minds. This is most impactful when we center our objective at improving the customer experience. It’s a privilege to work for such a great company, with amazing people, and leadership that cultivates a growth-mindset.” – Eric Hammes, executive vice president of Enterprise Operations at 3M

This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

The Inside Sales Representative will establish and maintain customer relationships, drive sales growth through virtual sales, up sell, and cross sell strategically aligned products within focused markets. This will be accomplished by utilizing detailed product and market knowledge in order to aid distribution partners and customers. This sales representative will be accountable to achieve monthly phone and activity goals while driving sales pipeline health and exceeding sales forecast through customer interactions, business plan creation and execution, and teaming with field sales representatives when appropriate.

Here, You Will Make An Impact By

As an Inside Sales Rep, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Driving 3M sales to assigned distribution in managed territories.Establishing and maintaining customer relationships through a comprehensive understanding of the customer’s business/sales models to help manage and influence business growth.Introducing new products, and communicating promotions to relevant customers and prospectsMaintaining and updating a working sales plan with strategies and tactics to achieve annual sales forecastsDemonstrating a proficient level of procedural and technical product knowledge to identify products that meet customer needsWorking to attain sales quota, sales quality, and sales productivity metricsSharing best practices with the team to promote a positive team environmentProficiently identifying market trends and account needs in order to react to market activity and reach favorable sales goals

Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher from (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution 

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

One (1) or more years of outside sales and/or inside sales experienceAccount management experiencePrevious retail experience is preferredSalesforce.com experience is desiredSkills include solution selling, listening skills, gain commitmentAbility to work effectively in a sales team environment - Creative problem-solving abilities are preferred Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing work environmentStrong organizational skills, with the ability to stay on tasks and maintain high productivity levels while working both in the office and remotely

Location: Positions will be performed remotely within the continental US and are not located at the corporate campus.

Travel: No Travel is anticipated or will be required

Relocation Assistance: Is Not Authorized

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.

Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.

Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.

3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

jobDescription:
Quidel Corporation is a is a leading manufacturer of diagnostic solutions at the point of care, delivering a continuum of rapid testing technologies that further improve the quality of health care throughout the globe. An innovator for over 40 years in the medical device industry, Quidel pioneered the first FDA-cleared point-of-care test for influenza in 1999 and was the first to market a rapid SARS-CoV-2 antigen test in the U.S. Under trusted brand names Sofia®, Solana®, Lyra®, Triage® and QuickVue®, Quidel’s comprehensive product portfolio includes tests for a wide range of infectious diseases, cardiac and autoimmune biomarkers, as well as a host of products to detect COVID-19. With products made in America, Quidel’s mission is to provide patients with immediate and frequent access to highly accurate, affordable testing for the good of our families, our communities and the world.
Quidel has an opportunity for a self-motivated and driven, Sales Representative to join our team in Northern UK. 
The Sales representative will work with the UK commercial organization to develop markets and customers (especially new hired customers), achieving sales targets, providing general customer service in the various areas of responsibility.
Requirements:Development of markets and customers (especially new hired customers), achieving sales targets, providing general customer service in the various areas of responsibilityResponsibility for the development and execution of the full Quidel product portfolio within the area, which includes the entire ID, Cardio metabolic and toxicology product portfoliosProposal preparation for customers as well as completion of contractsAbility to articulate issues and business opportunities with relevant customers to secure long term strategic business with customers of national significanceMonitor and report on competitive activities.
Knowledge/Skills:Primary degree in BA or equivalent work experience in the field of diagnosticsAt least 3 years’ experience working in Medical Devices or similar environmentDetailed understanding of the industryPreferential knowledge of the sales market and job profileDemonstrated ability to maintain positive people relationships and build strong links with all customersMust be results-orientated and able to work both independently and within a team environmentDemonstrated aptitude for problem-solving with the ability to determine solutions for customers (consultative sales approach)Self-starter, possesses flexibility and ability to work under pressure in a fast-changing environment and ambiguous situationsIdeally experience delivering change initiatives and facilitating change in a customer focused organisationAbility to think innovatively and not be constrained by current practicesExperience in working on strategic topicsAdvanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Excellent Compensation & Benefits Quidel UK Limited is an Equal Opportunities Employer

This is a fantastic opportunity for the right individual to join an innovative international company in a growing industry that can provide job security and genuine career advancement for those who show potential. We offer extensive training and ongoing support.
Reporting to the National Sales Manager, the successful applicant will be responsible for:

We are a start-up that aims to transform Latin America through education. Our team is based in Peru, Colombia, Mexico, Argentina, Chile, Ecuador, and Bolivia, and works towards the same goal: to make everyone's professional dream possible.

We started operations in 2015, and since, we have raised more than US$ 20 million of VC in 3 investment rounds. We are supported by global and regional investors, such as Acumen Capital, Mountain Nazca, Salesforce Ventures, and Rethink Education, with whom we seek to scale our course catalog, develop new products, consolidate our regional brand, and expand to new markets.

Crehana is growing by leaps and bounds, and our goal of being the leading education platform in the region is what drives us. This is where you come to play: we are looking for a Sales Manager in Lima, Perú to join our team and help us become the biggest EdTech in Latin America, transforming 700 million lives through education.

Your mission as a Sales Manager will be leading a fast-paced, highly-visible sales team that generates revenues and exceeds organizational and individual quotas. You'll be instrumental in driving the Crehana sales and company strategy. We are looking for an experienced, driven sales manager with a proven track record of success using a value-driven sales approach. If you are looking for a professional challenge that tests your knowledge and skills every day, we have the role for you!

As Sales Manager in Perú, you will be able to:
 Be responsible for setting and executing Crehana’s sales strategy for a given region. This leader will assume responsibility for a growing sales team to help drive complex deal transactions.  Revenue accountability will exceed $6MM annually  Manage and take accountability for negotiated non-standard contractual terms and conditions  Manage the performance of the Commercial Account Executive team including: recruiting, hiring, training, and professional development of individual team members  Support the targeting, planning, positioning, and execution of commercial opportunity development efforts as necessary to maximize the probability of success  Manage overall sales process, set appropriate metrics for sales funnel management  Set and execute an aggressive customer acquisition strategy to generate annual growth in revenue and bookings for the region  Work directly with the senior management team to shape strategies for driving sustainable business growth  Provide detailed and accurate sales forecasting to senior leadership  Plan and manage at both the strategic and operational levels  Collaborate with senior leaders and other relevant stakeholders to create, implement and manage policies and procedures to effectively support the business  Create and execute effective presentations, including corporate and solution capabilities, prospective client proposals, bid defense and business case/justification  Support Business Development efforts by attending industry conferences and events Supporting direct reports by participating and leading in client and prospect meetings and engaging other corporate resources as required  Ongoing mentoring and development of sales team which includes recruiting, on-boarding and training new Account Executives  Conducting weekly forecast meetings & one-on-one reviews with direct reports  Reporting on all aspects of the business to senior sales management  Monitoring the sales activity of the team, and tracking the results  Plan and execute marketing events in territory 

You Should Have
 Bachelor's degree and have a demonstrable, successful track record with a minimum of 5-8+ years experience in sales and a minimum of 3 as a sales manager  Strong negotiation skills and proven experience of successfully selling to and closing 7-figure contracts at the CxO level; familiarity with SaaS solutions for technical education is preferred  Strong interpersonal and communication skills; in addition, must have the ability to synthesize complex business challenges and create clear solutions and messages for audiences at various levels of sophistication  Must be a team player, able to handle ambiguity, anticipate and react to changes in a rapidly evolving environment  Consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals as a sales leader  Proven track record of building satisfied, loyal and reference able customers  Strong track record of recruiting, training/developing and retaining high performing sales talent  Ability to to listen, think logically, strategically, and tactically to solve complex problems  Self-motivated, demonstrating an ability to assume responsibility and work autonomously  Successful track record of planning, executing and closing business from field events  Strong operational and analytical abilities Ideal candidates will possess strong sales leadership experience, having sold software solutions to commercial and enterprise companies at the Director, VP and C level 

Benefits

We care about the well-being of our team, both personally and professionally. Therefore, we have a Wellness & Benefits Program that meets the diverse needs of each Crehaner. If you want to know more, make sure to check this link.

You will be part of one of the online learning platforms with the greatest growth projection in Latin America and Spain. There are already more than 4 million students around the world and more than 100 companies that trust Crehana. We are part of Wayra, Startup Peru, Emerge Education, and Endeavor Global.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

At Crehana, we don't just accept differences: we celebrate, support, and promote diversity as an important pillar of our culture. We pride ourselves on being a workplace with equal opportunities for everyone and anyone, regardless of religion, race, nationality, origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, or person with any type of disability. Our goal is to have a diverse team that represents what we seek to build: an inclusive, empowered, and educated Latin America.

Covid-19

We have decided to remain working remotely in all of our locations. Our number one priority is that our team and the people they care for are safe and well.

Are you a self-motivated and gregarious sales representative that wants to make money selling an innovative technology? Do you want to join a high energy company with an amazing culture? If you thrive in a competitive and collaborative team environment then this may be the position for you!

About The Position

As a Sales Development Representative you will have an opportunity to be a key strategic contributor -- Bringing your intense work ethic and desire to make an immediate impact. You will gain invaluable experience, and have the chance to showcase your acquired knowledge. You will take ownership of your assigned sales targets by educating restaurant owners on our value proposition and generating opportunities for your sales partners. This will be done through 100% cold outreach.

You will constantly be collaborating with your peers and manager to create awareness with your prospects, demonstrating that you are a thought leader in the restaurant technology space, and helping restaurateurs improve their business by using the ChowNow platform. This position requires the right combination of grit, curiosity and drive to help small business owners with their daily challenges.

This is a 100% remote role. Reports to Sales Development Manager; No Direct Reports.

About Us

ChowNow is unique among tech startups in the restaurant space. We power branded online ordering systems for independent restaurants across North America – via websites, Google, Instagram, and through branded iOS and Android apps – and we do it all for a reasonable monthly fee regardless of order volume. We operate this way because of our belief in being fair, sustainable, and equitable with our restaurant partners. And the same goes for our workplace.

Diversity, teamwork, and mutual respect are among our core company values. And we pride ourselves on giving our teams plenty of opportunities to make their mark. To date we’ve created over 20,000 apps for our restaurant partners – something that’s never been done before in our category. And as we expand to new markets, further spreading the word about the ChowNow difference, those opportunities to create, build, and grow will only increase. If this sounds like the kind of workplace, and the kind of mission, that appeals to you, we’d love to talk.

Learn more by checking out our reviews on Glassdoor (they’re excellent). Together we can preserve neighborhood flavor, one restaurant at a time.

Within 1 Month, You'll...
Progress through our Ramp Camp (ChowNow’s New Hire Onboarding Experience)Dive right in and quickly start developing an understanding of our target customer profile and qualifying criteria for opportunitiesLearn how to utilize a wide range of sales tools (Salesforce, Outreach, Chili Piper) and incorporate into the ChowNow sales processStart hopping on the phones and driving high volume, consultative discovery conversations with prospective clients to identify if they’re a potential fit for ChowNowBuild close relationships with your sales partners to develop pipeline and strategy to saturate markets

Within 3 Months, You'll...
Become a fully ramped SDR while hitting your activity goalsForm a tight knit, well oiled partnership with your sales partners and bring in assisted revenue to ChowNowUnderstand the importance of reports and dashboards in Salesforce to evaluate your pipeline and KPIs

Within 6 Months, You'll...
Hit and exceed your activity goals of 100 outbound calls and five set meetings with new restaurants each day.Contribute to the growth of the team by sharing knowledge and participating in shadow sessions with new team membersDevelop thorough knowledge of the ChowNow product and become a trusted consultant to prospective restaurants.Begin working towards your career progression within ChowNow

About Our Benefits
Competitive compensation and commission planOngoing training and growth opportunities.A "Best Place to Work" winner multiple times where we focus on creating a great employee experience.A remote first culture and monthly stipend offering flexibility to work where you want and how you want.Rock solid medical, dental, and vision plans.Mental Health Coverage - we offer several programs to support your mental health and wellness goals.3 weeks paid vacation; paid holidays; we expect you to work hard, but still enjoy your personal life7 weeks of baby bonding time for all new parents (within the first year of birth or adoption), 8 Weeks of Paid Pregnancy Leave.401(k) MatchingEmployer-contributing student loan assistance program.Commuter benefits (including Uber Pool).Employee Stock Incentive Plan.Pet insurance for your fur babiesQuarterly Industry Speakers Series.Quarterly Tech Events (Women, LGBTQ, Diversity, Inclusion).Consistent & fair leadership: we’ll share info, set clear goals, show you respect, and treat everyone fairly.Enough freedom to spread your wings while still holding you accountable.Fully stocked kitchen and cold brew on tap.

As one of ChowNow’s core values, “Celebrates Diversity”, we are committed to an inclusive and diverse work environment. ChowNow is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

(trust us, these bring a BIG smile to your face)  -TRAVEL - you can earn the opportunity to travel every month  -Team-centered culture with caring leadership and teammates!-Quick upward mobility into a Sales Executive position (within the first year)

With the continued impact of COVID-19 and social distancing measures, Spring Venture Group fully supports remote interviewing and on-boarding procedures. Due to the impact of Covid 19 we offer flexible work options (work from home, hybrid, or in office.)

In order to be eligible for our Remote Inside Sales Agent position you must currently live in Miami, FL. 

Who We Are

As a leader in Medicare, we guide people through one of their most important decisions. We're on a mission to improve lives by doing work that matters - protecting our clients’ health and financial well-being. This starts with a workplace where you feel empowered to do your best work. You can make a meaningful impact, and build a rewarding career in a diverse, inclusive environment. Bring determination and a desire to crush your goals.

What We Want
